messages.subject: typical days (was  An unschooled lesson in balance)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/3/03 2:07:01 AM, jmcseals@msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/3/03 2:07:01 AM, jmcseals@... writes:

<< I know so many people hear ideas of what *could* be done in an
unschooling situation that constitutes math (or whatever) like shopping with
Mom, but actual accounts are hard to find. For me anyway...am I missing
something?? Would anyone here be interested in that sort of thing?
>>

If you do, save the good parts for me, because I'm starting a collection, as
part of an unfinished set of stuff which starts here
http://sandradodd.com/life

but the "typical day" collection is here:
http://sandradodd.com/typical

and I have a few more I haven't put in yet. If any of you want to send one,
do!!

There's a book called Patchwork of Days with people's typical days but VERY
few were unschoolers (maybe just our family, come to think of it, and most
were very church and structure oriented, so I wanted an unschooling
collection.

If you're doing something other than typical days, ignore this. <g>

Sandra
